entity1.name: Electricity
entity1.description: A form of energy resulting from the movement of charged particles, used as a power source for various applications.;;;A form of energy resulting from the movement of charged particles, widely used for powering various devices and systems.;;;A form of energy resulting from the movement of charged particles, commonly used to power homes, businesses, and industries.;;;The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry, business, and medicine.;;;A field that encompasses the design, development, and application of computer systems and technologies.;;;A fundamental physical phenomenon characterized by the presence and flow of electric charge, which has been harnessed for various applications in technology and industry.;;;The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, including the creation of tools, devices, systems, and methods to solve problems or improve existing solutions.;;;A form of energy resulting from the movement of charged particles, such as electrons or protons.
entity1.chunkid: How Electricity Revolutionized the World5;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World14;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World16;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World4;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World9;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World3;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World13;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World17;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World1;;;How Electricity Revolutionized the World18

entity2.name: World
entity2.description: The planet Earth, including all its countries, continents, and regions where human civilization exists.

entity4.name: society
entity4.description: The aggregate of people living together in a more or less ordered community.

entity5.name: economy
entity5.description: The system of production and distribution and consumption. The overall structure of the economic activity in a country, region, or area.

entity9.name: Electric appliances
entity9.description: A category of household items that use electricity to perform tasks, such as washing machines, refrigerators, and stoves.

entity10.name: Washing machines
entity10.description: An electric device used for cleaning clothes automatically.

entity11.name: Refrigerators
entity11.description: An appliance designed to keep food and drinks at a low temperature to preserve them.

entity12.name: Stoves
entity12.description: A kitchen appliance used for cooking food, typically with multiple burners or an oven.

entity14.name: public health
entity14.description: The science and practice of preventing disease, prolonging life, and promoting health through organized efforts and informed choices of society, organizations, public and private communities, and individuals.

entity15.name: safety
entity15.description: The condition of being protected from or unlikely to cause danger, risk, or injury.

entity16.name: Electric lighting
entity16.description: A technology that allows the production of artificial light through electrical means.

entity17.name: cities
entity17.description: Urban areas characterized by a high population density and man-made infrastructure.

entity18.name: Electric heating and cooling systems
entity18.description: Systems used to regulate indoor temperatures through electrical means.

entity19.name: Heatstroke
entity19.description: A severe condition caused by overheating of the body, often due to prolonged exposure to high temperatures.

entity20.name: Hypothermia
entity20.description: A dangerous drop in body temperature usually resulting from prolonged exposure to cold conditions.

entity22.name: industrialization
entity22.description: The process by which an economy is transformed from primarily agricultural to one based on the manufacturing of goods and services.

entity23.name: economic growth
entity23.description: An increase in the capacity of an economy to produce goods and services, compared from one period of time to another.

entity24.name: Factories
entity24.description: Facilities dedicated to the production of goods, often part of a larger industrial complex.;;;Industrial buildings or complexes where goods are manufactured.

entity27.name: Machinery and equipment
entity27.description: Tools, machines, and devices used in industrial processes to facilitate production.

entity29.name: global trade
entity29.description: The exchange of goods and services between countries around the world.

entity30.name: communication
entity30.description: The process by which information is exchanged between individuals through speaking, writing, or using some other medium.

entity33.name: electrical engineering
entity33.description: A field of engineering that deals with the study and application of electricity, electronics, and electromagnetism.

entity34.name: telecommunications
entity34.description: The industry involved in the transmission of information over distances through various media such as telephone, radio, television, and the internet.

entity35.name: transportation
entity35.description: The industry concerned with the movement of people and goods from one place to another using different modes like road, rail, air, and sea.

entity37.name: telegraph
entity37.description: An early communication system that used electrical signals to transmit messages over long distances.

entity38.name: telephone
entity38.description: A device for transmitting sound, especially the human voice, over a distance using electricity.

entity39.name: internet
entity39.description: A global network connecting millions of private, public, academic, business, and government networks, allowing for the exchange of data and information over vast distances.

entity40.name: electric cars
entity40.description: Vehicles powered by electricity, used for personal or commercial transportation.

entity41.name: trains
entity41.description: A form of transport that runs on tracks and is typically used for long-distance travel or urban transit.

entity42.name: greenhouse gas emissions
entity42.description: Gases that trap heat in the atmosphere, contributing to global warming and climate change.

entity43.name: sustainable energy sources
entity43.description: Sources of energy that are renewable and have a low environmental impact, such as solar or wind power.

entity44.name: computers
entity44.description: Electronic devices that can process and store data, used for various tasks including work, learning, and entertainment.;;;A broad category of equipment that uses electricity to function, often used in conjunction with computers for various applications.
